--- layout: default title: Neuroimaging Statistics Research at Warwick ---
This collection organizes all available talks by the NeuroStatistics at Warwick group during the years 2014-2017.

Talks

This section lists all available Neuroimaging Statistics Research at Warwick standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Neural correlates of the LSD experience revealed by multimodal neuroimaging.
    Author: Mark Fiecas. 28th April 2016. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443540.v1
  • Neuroanatomical diversity of corpus callosum and brain volume in autism: meta-analysis, analysis of the Autism Brain Imaging Data Exchange (Abide) project, and simulation.
    Author: Camille Maumet. 26th February 2015. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443570.v1
  • Corticocortical evoked potentials reveal projectors and integrators in human brain networks.
    Author: Ruth Harbord. 19 February 2015. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443594.v1
  • SGPP - spatial Gaussian predictive process models for neuroimaging data.
    Author: Silvia Montagna. 5th February 2015. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443543.v1
  • Identifying functional co-activation patterns in neuroimaging studies via Poisson graphical models.
    Author: Pantelis Samartsidis. 29th January 2015. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443588.v1
  • Warped linear mixed models for the genetic analysis of transformed phenotypes.
    Author: Habib Ganjgahi. 22nd January 2015. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443582.v1
  • Let's chop them up! A brief survey on SIR techniques.
    Author: Chenyang Tao. 21st January 2015. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443579.v1
  • MRI texture analysis for the characterisation of childhood brain tumours.
    Author: Ahmed Fetit. 4th December 2014. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443555.v1
  • Functional Bayesian point process model for neuroimaging meta-analysis data.
    Author: Silvia Montagna. 27 November 2014. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443600.v1
  • Spatial Bayesian Variable Selection Models on Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging Time-Series Data.
    Author: Pantelis Samartsidis. 16th October 2014. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443522.v1
  • Life in a shell (2): Getting the Most Out of Linux/Unix.
    Author: Thomas Nichols. 9th October 2014. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443612.v1
  • Life in a shell: Getting the Most Out of Linux/Unix.
    Author: Thomas Nichols. 25th September 2014. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5443606.v1
